alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 3:28PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cameron County through 400 PM CDT... At 327 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gallegos Elementary School, or over Cameron Park. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Olmito, Southmost, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, B I S D Administration Building, Longoria Elementary School, Sams Memorial Stadium and Hanna High School. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 1 and 11. US Highway 281 between mile markers 834 and 838. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
